Julio vive con sus padres, tiene dos hermanas, su padre es jubilado y su madre es ama de casa. Él está estudiando hoy la carrera de didáctica superior universitaria.
Él está capacitándose ya que desea independizarse para formar una familia. Es por eso que desea con ansias el título de docente. De aquí a un tiempo se ve ejerciendo la docencia en una universidad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Julio  lives with his parents. His father is retired and his mother is a housewife. He has two sisters. José is currently studying for a  degree in university education.

Julio is getting an education in order to become independent from his family. As a result Julio is anxious to receive his teaching certificate. Julio sees himself soon working as a lecturer in a university.

Julio is applying for this loan in order to invest in paying university fees and continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea is 57 years old and has 10 children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school.

Dorotea is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Dorotea requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Dorotea has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Dorotea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gregoria is 48 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a buy-and-sell scrap materials business in the Philippines. Gregoria requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

Gregoria has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for five years now.

Primitiva would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay fees.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es:
Brenda está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Agrónoma, por medio de este profesión quiere abrirse camino, y el día de mañana poder trabajar y luchar para ayudar a su familia.
Ella es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, y comenta que está poniendo todo de sí para ser un profesional destacado en la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de cuotas, y de esa forma seguir luchando por cumplir su sueño de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Brenda is studying for a degree in agronomic engineering. With this degree, she wants to open up different paths in life and work and fight to help her family in the future.

Brenda is from the city of Caaguazú and says that she is doing everything that she can in order to become a great professional in society.

Brenda is applying for this loan in order to pay university fees and continue fighting for her dream of being somebody important in life.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois est l’un des plus expérimentés du système et groupe en son sein des femmes qui ont une grande maîtrise du programme. La cohabitation durant des années a pu souder les liens qui sont caractérisés. Ayant  un long vécu dans le programme des bancs villageois, elles ont su développer un esprit de solidarité de groupe leur permettant de nos jours de faire face à beaucoup de situations. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Aissatou (debout à l’extrême droite  avec la main  gauche levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe, âgée de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 01 garçon et 03 filles. C’est une femme très engagée dans la vie du banc villageois et dans ses propres activités génératrices de revenu. Elle s’active dans la vente de sucre et de glace qu’elle mène dans les villages suivant les jours de marché hebdomadaire. Pour se faire elle fabrique elle-même une partie de la glace et l’autre partie est achetée par commande auprès d’autres femmes. Elle fait ses emballages à l’aide de glacière et sacs vides pour la vente dans les marchés. 

Avec ce prêt elle va acheter  5 sacs de sucre de 50 kg, renouveler une de ses glacières et aussi acheter des paquets de sacs pour glace.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  et  de participer activement dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille sur le plan sanitaire, éducation des enfants et nourriture.
texts.en:
This banc villageois is one of the most experienced, and one of its groups of women are masters of the program. The ties among this group were formed over the many years the women have been together. Their long-time involvement in the banc villageois has allowed them to develop a spirit of group solidarity which has enabled them to face many situations. The group members work for the most part in small-scale commerce.

Aissatou (who is standing on the far right with her left hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 56 years old, married, and a mother of four children, of whom one is a boy and three are girls. 

Aissatou is very involved in the life of the banc villageois and in her business. She works selling sugar and ice in the villages following the days of the weekly market. To do this, she makes some of ice and buys the rest from other women. She makes packs of ice and sells them with the help of an icebox and empty bags.

With this loan, she is going to buy five 50-kilogram sacs of sugar and some packages of bags. She will also fix one of her iceboxes.

Earnings from this business will allow her to save and to actively take care of her family's expenses related to health, food, and her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy five 50-kilogram sacs of sugar and bags, and to fix an icebox

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 10 Décembre 2012, le banc villageois est composé de femmes très désireuses de faire prospérer leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Il existe une bonne connexion entre les membres du groupe, elles viennent d’entamer leur quatrième cycle dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles habitent toutes le même quartier et s’activent principalement dans le petit commerce et la transformation de produits locaux.

Madame Awa est une jeune dame très dynamique, qui connait une nette amélioration de son activité depuis son adhésion au programme. Elle tient une gargote dans une allée très fréquentée où elle sert divers plats et jus à base de produits locaux. Pour se faire elle achète du niébé pour 600 Fr le kg, du petit pois à 1 000 Fr le kg, des paquets de spaghetti à 250 Fr l’unité et de la viande à 2 000 Fr le kg et prépare pour le service au soir.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte s’approvisionner en quantité en niébé, petit pois respectivement 15 et 20 kg un carton de 24 paquets de spaghetti et divers ingrédients.

Ses bénéfices, en plus de soutenir ses parents lui permettront d’avoir une indépendance financière pour la satisfaction de ses besoins.
texts.en:
Created on 10 December 2012, the banc villageois is made up of women who desire to make their businesses prosper. The group members have a good connection, and they all have just started their fourth cycle in the program. The women live in the same area and all work in small-scale commerce and the production of local goods.

Awa is a young, very dynamic woman, who has seen her business improve since joining the program. She runs a small restaurant in a busy alley, where she serves various meals and juice made from local products.

For the dinner service, she buys black-eyed peas for 600 francs a kilogram, green peas for 1,000 francs a kilogram, packages of spaghetti for 250 francs each, and meat for 2,000 francs a kilogram.

With this new loan, she plans to procure 15 kilograms of black-eyed peas, 20 kilograms of green peas, a box of 24 packages of spaghetti, and other ingredients.

Earnings, in addition to support from her parents, allow her to have the financial independence to take care of her needs.

loans.use: to buy black-eyed peas, green peas, spaghetti, and other ingredients

loans.name: Faty's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de trente femmes, fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 22 octobre 2010. Ce banc  regroupe des femmes qui viennent du même village et ceux des alentours. Des femmes très solidaires. 
Binetou debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est veuve et a 4 enfants dont 3 garçons.
Avec le prêt elle envisage de faire de l’embouche ovine et du commerce de légumes. Elle va acheter 5 moutons pour une valeur de 125000f. Des moutons de 25000f et de 20000f pour l’opération Tabaski prochaine. Avec les 25000f restant elle va renforcer son commerce de légumes.
Les bénéfices lui serviront à entretenir ses enfants et à renforcer son épargne dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group of 30 women make up a part of the banc villageois that was established on 22 October 2010. The members come from the same village or surrounds. They share a high level of solidarity.

Binetou, standing on the right with her hand raised, is 54 years old. She is a widow and has four children, of whom three are boys.

With this loan, she plans to raise some sheep and sell vegetables. She is going to buy five sheep for 125,000 francs, some for 25,000 francs and some for 20,000 francs for the next Tabaski festival.

With the remaining 25,000 francs, she is going to strengthen her business selling vegetables. 

Earnings will serve to take care of her children and increase her savings in the banc villageois.

loans.use: to buy five sheep and some vegetables

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de trente cinq femmes, fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 22 octobre 2010. Ce banc  regroupe des femmes qui viennent du même village et ceux des alentours. Des femmes très solidaires. 
Aminata debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 52 ans. 
Elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 5 garçons.
Avec le prêt elle va faire du commerce et profiter de l’hivernage pour faire de l’agriculture.
Elle va acheter avec les 20000f des légumes pour les vendre. Avec le reste elle va acheter de l’arachide comme semences.
Avec les bénéfices elle va épauler son mari à assurer la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en: This group of 35 women are part of a village bank that was created on October 22, 2010.  This bank consists of women who come from the same village and other surrounding villages.  The women are very supportive of one another.  Aminata is 52 years old and standing at the right of the photo with her hand raised. She is married and mother of nine children including five boys. With this loan, she will run a business and take advantage of the winter to farm.  She will buy vegetable for resale with the 20,000 francs.  With the remaining funds, she will buy groundnuts and seeds. WIth the profits, she will help her husband pay for household expenses.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and groundnuts.

loans.name: Terry

texts.en:
Terry is 46 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Terry runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, cooking oil, biscuits, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Terry would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan, 60 years old, lives in a rural area of the Srei Santhor District in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has four children, three of whom are already married. Phan has been working as a farmer in a small rice field near her house for more than 40 years. The net profit that she can earn is $3 per day.

Phan wants to improve her living conditions by having a hygienic latrine. Phan is borrowing a loan from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Through this loan, Phan hopes to provide healthy living conditions for her family. Phan thanks lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than with its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo de todas están mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Una persona que se destaca por su trabajo es la Sra. Valeria, quien se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, tanto para mates, terere, y tés, y por medio de este humilde trabajo da a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones. Comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que aunque su trabajo es humilde, por medio de esto está creciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus trabajo y con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, ella esta agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Emprendedoras is in its 7th loan cycle in the program of women's committees, where they all work and help each get ahead.  They are completing the poverty elimination tool where, thanks to the work of all the members, they are improving their poverty situation.

One person who stands out for her work is Valeria, who works selling natural medicine such as different infusions including mate, tereré, and teas, and by this humble work she gives her family all that they need to live a respectable life without privations.  She says that she is very proud of what she does, since although her work is humble, through it she is developing.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of natural remedies for sale, because in this way she will be able to continue with her work and with her sales as she has been doing.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to improve her life.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines for sale.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Maria Auxiliadora 2 se formó en Ciudad del Este, está en su 5to ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz, quien en su encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo y por medio de la venta de prendas de todo tipo que hace, está pudiendo salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Liz comenta que está luchando día a día desde muy temprano, y que trabaja hasta muy tarde, es una soñadora y sacrificada persona.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, como jeans, remeras, pantalones, camisas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group called Maria Auxiliadora 2 was formed in Ciudad del Este. It is in its 5th loan cycle with the women's committee program, where they all pledge to work and help each other get ahead.  They are completing the poverty elimination tool, by which they will be able to know each one of their situations. 

One of the members is Liz, who on her tool showed a poverty level within level one, where through her efforts and work, and by the sale of clothing of all types that she does, she is being able to get ahead and help her family.  Liz says that she is fighting day by day from very early and works until very late.  She is a self-sacrificing person with dreams. 

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of clothing, such as jeans, t-shirts, pants, shirts, and others, to be able to continue with her work.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, t-shirts, pants, shirts and other clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Ethelvina

texts.es: Rosa tiene 44 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, Rosa se dedica 23 años a su negocio de venta de ropa en un local que paga arriendo para ofrecer sus productos,  con el credito Rosa va a comprar mercaderia en ropa y tambien en productos de visuteria, Rosa espera de su negocio que mejore para seguir paando os estudios de su hijos.
texts.en: Rosa is 44 years old, married, and has three children who are students.  Rosa has worked for 23 years in her clothing business in a retail space that she rents in order to offer her products.  With the loan, Rosa will purchase merchandise in clothing and also costume jewelry. Rosa hopes that her business will improve in order to continue paying for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in clothing.

loans.name: Achica Arriba Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ACHICA ARRIBA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa y chuño, tienda de barrio, servicio de construcción, venta de hortalizas, venta de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Elena es integrante, ella indica que  hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tienda de barrio; da a conocer que la venta de este producto lo inicio hace varios años, al obtener su primer préstamo, decide emprender este negocio en su domicilio. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de  arroz y fideo por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y vive con sus padres.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “ACHICA ARRIBA” solidarity group is in its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal e Santiago II.  It is comprised of eight members and is run by a board of officers of which María Elena is the president. The members of the group have a variety of businesses that they carry out, including the sale of potatoes and chuño (a freeze-dried potato product), a neighborhood store, construction service, sale of vegetables, and sale of potatoes.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small business owners such as María Elena. She says that a year ago, she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  At the moment she has a neighborhood store.  She said that she began the sale of these products a number of years ago.  Upon receiving her first loan, she decided to open this business in her home.

The loan that she is getting now is to increase the capital (purchase rice and beans in bulk) that she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and later will sell in her retail space.  This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and lives with her parents. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training opportunities and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans in bulk

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy, 36 years old, lives in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. He has 2 children who are enrolled in the local primary school near his house. Vy has been working as a farmer on a small piece of farm land for more than ten years. The net profit that he can make is USD 3 per day.

Vy wants to improve his living conditions by putting in place a hygienic latrine which he has never had before. He is borrowing money from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members. Through this loan, he hopes that he will be able to promote healthy living conditions. 

Vy would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than is available for general loan products.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marina is 50 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Marina has a native basket weaving business in the Philippines. Marina requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.

Marina has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Marina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a trading business.

loans.name: Siembra Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SIEMBRA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Edith es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de carne y edredones, costura de batas de bebe, servicio de lavado de autos, tienda de barrio, venta de golocinas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Edith es integrante, ella indica que  hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de lana; da a conocer que la venta de este producto lo inicio hace varios años, al observar la diversidad y amplia comercialización que tenía este producto en el mercado paceño, decide emprenderlo. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de  lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, el crédito y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “SIEMBRA” communal group will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Santiago II, and is comprised of nine members, directed by a board of officers, of which Edith is the president. The businesses that the association members carry out are varied and among them are the sale of blankets, the sale of meat and quilts, sewing bathrobes for young children, a car wash service, a neighborhood store and candy sales.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small business owners including Edith. She said that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  Currently, she has a business selling wool; she said that she has sold this product for a number of years.  Upon seeing the diversity and wide sales that this product had in the market in La Paz, she decided to take it up. 

The loan that she is now getting is to augment her capital (purchasing wool in bulk) which she will get from the wholesale merchants in the city of La Paz and later will sell in her retail space. This type of work permits her to generate resources to support her family since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training programs, the loans, and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wool in bulk.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 60 years old and married with one child. Minda works very hard to provide for them.

Minda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like bread, snack foods, juice, soft-drinks, beers, sanitary pads and other groceries to sell.

Minda has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, snack foods, juice, soft-drinks, beers, sanitary pads and other groceries. 

In the future, Minda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like bread, snack foods, juice, soft-drinks, beers, sanitary pads and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Phillex

texts.en:
Phillex deals in electronics alongside farming mainly cassava and maize in Hoima, Uganda. He repairs radios and televisions. He works seven days a week and started business in 2008. He is married with two children aged between 8 and 4. 

He hopes to improve his service to his customers by providing them with a range of different products. High rent is still a hindrance to his business.

Phillex is acquiring credit to buy spare parts for his workshop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his workshop.

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mira is 36 years old and has five children who are in school.

Mira has a general store business in the Philippines. Mira requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, candies, biscuits, juice, coffee, etc. to sell.

Mira has been in this business for a year. In the future, Mira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, candies, biscuits, juice, coffee to sell.

loans.name: Aura Pastora

texts.es: Aura es una señora casada que vive con su esposo y su hijo de 10 años el que se encuentra asistiendo a a escuela, Aura tiene 44 años de edad y se dedica 20 años a la ganaderia, comenta Aura que el cuidar ganado es algo complicado ya que para el ordeñoo de sus vacas diariamente tiene que ir a la madrugada para regresar a mandar a su hijo a la escuela y que no se atrace, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca, Aura aspira seguir adelante en su actividad y a su hijo darle lo necesario para que su hijo estudie.
texts.en: Aura is a married lady who lives with her husband and her child who is 10 years old and is a student. Aura is 44 years old and has worked for 20 years in animal husbandry.  Aura says that taking care of cattle is something complicated because of the daily milking, so she has to go early in the morning and return to send her son to school so that he isn't late. The loan will be invested in the purchase of a cow.  Aura aspires to get ahead with her work and to give her son what he needs for school.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Mujeres Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES POR SIEMPRE” iniciará el trigésimo cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Filomena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de carpintería, tienda de barrio, servicio de limpieza, venta de helados, venta de víveres, costura de deportivos, servicios de naturista, venta de cosméticos, elaboración de legía, muñequería tradicional.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Filomena es integrante, ella indica que  hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de abarrotes; da a conocer que la venta de estos productos lo inicio hace varios años, al observar la amplia comercialización que tenía este producto en el mercado paceño emprende su negocio propio con un capital básico. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de  arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “MUJERES POR SIEMPRE” communal group will begin its thirty-fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Santiago II, and is comprised of twelve members, run by a board of officers of which Filomena is the president.  The businesses the members carry out are varied and among them are a carpentry shop, a neighborhood store, a cleaning service, ice cream sales, grocery sales, sewing sports clothing, a health food service, cosmetics sale, and making legía, traditional dolls.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small business owners including Filomena. She says that seven years ago, she joined Pro Mujer, at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  Currently, she has a business selling groceries. She said that she began selling these products a number of years ago.  Upon seeing their wide sale in the La Paz market, she took this up as her own business with some basic capital. 

The loan that she is getting now is to increase her capital (to purchase rice in bulk) that she will get from the wholesale merchants in La Paz, and later will sell in her retail space. This type of work permits her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training programs that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase rice in bulk

loans.name: Manitos De Oro Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANITOS DE ORO II” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Andrea es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, venta de comida, taller de carpintería, venta de tela, venta de ropa, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Andrea es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  tejido de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace varios años, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre, es por ello que con un poco capital guardado decide emprender un negocio independiente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “MANITOS DE ORO II” communal group will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Focal de Collpani, and is comprised of eight members, and run by a board of officers of which Andrea is the president.  The businesses that the group members carry out are varied and include cosmetics sales, food sales, a carpentry shop, fabric sales, clothing sales, and a transportation service. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners including Andrea.  She said that a year ago she joined Pro Mujer, at the invitation of a staff person who went to visit her in her home.  Currently she has a business knitting sweaters. She says that she began this business a number of years ago, learning it from her mother, and it is because of this that with some capital she had saved, she decided to open an independent business.

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her capital (to purchase wool in bulk) that she will get from the wholesale merchants in El Alto and later, after making them, will put them in her retail space. This sort of work permits her to generate resources to help support her family since she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training programs and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase wool in bulk.

loans.name: Margarita De Cota Cota Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARGARITAS DE COTA COTA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de leche, producción de queso, venta de leche.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilaria es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de leche; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia hace varios años al observar a una de sus padres, quien le enseñaron la forma de venta de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra forraje por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad, posteriormente alimentará a su ganado para una buena producción. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “MARGARITAS DE COTA COTA” communal group will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal e Copacabana, is comprised of eight members, and is directed by a board of officers of which Hilaria is the president. The businesses that the group members carry out are varied and among them are milk production, cheese production and milk sales.

The credit that they will take out will benefit the small business owners including Hilaria. She said that this is the first time that she joined Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a massive promotion held by the institution.  Currently, she has a business producing milk. She says that she began this business a number of years ago after watching one of her parents who taught her how to sell this product.

The credit that she is getting now is for feed during the drought (to purchase forage in bulk) that she will get from the wholesale merchants in her community, later she will feed her cows for a good production. This type of work permits her to generate resources to support her family since she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the life insurance the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase forage in bulk

loans.name: Colle's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 6 femmes fait parti du banc villageois a été créé le 21 décembre 2009. Il est composé des membres qui habitent le même village. Les membres entretiennent de très bonnes relations et sont solidaires entre eux. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Mame debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 31.Elle est mariée et mère de 2 garçons et d'une fille. Elle s’investit dans la coiffure. Elle fait cette activité depuis bien longtemps, mais elle a ouvert un salon de coiffure qu’elle gère elle-même il y a de cela un an. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine et s’en sort parfaitement bien.
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter des mèches, des greffages, des produits de beautés de tout genre et des produits dé-frisants pour renforcer son activité. Avec le reste de l’argent, elle achète des produits dé-frisants, des produits maquillant et démaquillants, des produits capillaires et d’autres produits de beauté, mais aussi des désinfectants.
Avec les bénéfices générés, elle réinvestit dans son activité. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion du foyer à chaque fois que l’occasion s’en fait sentir à savoir l’habillement des enfants et dès fois leurs frais scolaires. Elle s’occupe aussi de son bien être propre.
texts.en:
This six-member group, which belongs to the banc villageois, was created on 21st December 2009. Its members all live in the same village. These women enjoy good relationships with each other and there is a sense of group solidarity. Their main money-generating activity is commerce.

Mame, the woman standing to the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 31 years old. She is a married mother to two boys and one girl. She works in hairdressing. She has been doing this for a long time, but she only opened up her own hair salon, which she herself runs, around one year ago. She has a lot of experience in this area and is doing well for herself.

With this loan, she is going to purchase hair extensions, all kinds of beauty products and hair straightening products in order to strengthen her business. With the rest of the money, she will buy make-up and make-up remover, hair products and other beauty products, as well as disinfectants.

She will reinvest the profits into her business. She helps her husband with the family's expenses when it comes to their children's clothing and school fees. She will also use the money to look after her own needs.

loans.use: to purchase various beauty products

loans.name: Emmaculada

texts.en:
Emmaculada works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Emmaculada requested a 29000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Emmaculada has been in this business for 13 years now.

Emmaculada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a fifty-year-old woman with five grandchildren. She is widowed and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For the last five years she has managed to maintain her family by selling cocoa from her garden.She wishes to expand her business's production though competition and seasonality changes affects her. 

Beatrice is a hardworking woman who is asking for a loan to buy cocoa to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 56 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like coffee, seasonings, cereals, canned goods, rice, cooking oil, candies, etc. to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, seasonings, cereals, canned goods, rice, cooking oil, candies, etc. 

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like coffee, seasonings, cereals, canned goods, rice, cooking oil, candies to sell.

loans.name: Zakiya

texts.en:
Zakiya, a twenty-six-year-old female, lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is married with five children and all go to school. Zakiya depends on cocoa farming, she finds it difficult to meet her financial obligations as she has a low yield. That's why she decided to start buying cocoa to increase her sales. 

She dreams of expanding her business by renting more cocoa gardens to increase her stock though unpredictable weather changes affect her. Zakiya will use the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Floreda

texts.en:
Floreda is 65 years old and married with four children.

Floreda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Floreda has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Floreda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood and materials to execute the orders.

loans.name: Baramu

texts.en:
Baramu, a twenty-five-year-old male, lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is married with two children and only one goes to school. As cocoa is his major business, when it isn't the cocoa season, Baramu finds it difficult to meet his financial obligations, that's why he decided to start up a retail shop. 

He dreams of buying land for farming though insufficient funds affect him. Baramu needs a loan to buy general merchandise like plastic shoes, eggs, sugar and sweets to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like plastic shoes, eggs, sugar and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Margie is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Margie has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Margie requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Margie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. Yolanda is married and has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years now.

Yolanda requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of used clothing to sell.

Yolanda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Diantoyerela I Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  DIANTOYERELA I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KADIANA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est : le riz et l’arachide  avec FANTA  2ème personne debout sur la photo de la gauche à la droite. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2 hectares. La production est vendue au niveau de  KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 100.00FCFA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Diantoyerela 1 Group are married women with an average age of 45 and an average of four children each. They all live within polygamous family frameworks in Kadiana in Kolondieba Cercle, one of the prefectures found in the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution so that they can see through their agricultural activities during the winter period. This is their second loan with Soro Yiriwaso, with whom their previous loans were paid back in full. The group's main produce is rice and peanuts. 

The group's representative is Fanta, the woman standing second from the left in the back row in the photo. With this loan, she is planning on purchasing farming inputs and seeds, as well as paying for the labour costs to maintain two hectares of land. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in Kadiana to a customer base made up of both men and woman. She is planning on making a profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will allow her to pay off the loan and help her husband with their family's daily living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for labour costs, seeds and farming inputs during the farming season

loans.name: Cresenciana

texts.en:
Cresenciana is 59 years old and married with ten children. 

Cresenciana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Cresenciana has been raising pigs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cresenciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, a 38-year-old female, lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is married with four children and all go to school. Cocoa is the major business that Rose depends on. When cocoa season is off, she finds it difficult to meet her financial obligations. That's why she decided to start renting a cocoa garden, to yield more when it's the peak and save for the future. She dreams of buying land for farming, though seasonal changes and insufficient funds affect her. Rose will use the loan to rent a cocoa garden to increase her sales.

loans.use: to rent a cocoa garden to increase her sales.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan was born in 1993. She is married and is bringing up two little children. Gulshan is a third-year medical student at the college. She is a full-time student who is very hardworking and industrious and she tries to bring up her children well. She reads many books and tries to learn all of her subject well. Gulshan must pay for her tuition, but she does not have money. 

Gulshan is requesting a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to  pay medical school tuition

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es: Manuel es señor que tiene 2 hijos uno de ellos esta estudiando, Manuel se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace 5 años, Manuel comenta que aunque no vive con sus hijos si se hace cargo de los gastos de los chicos, Manuel dice que se siente contento ya que su hijo mayor ya es profecional y que de esa misma forma tiene que sacar adelante a su hijo de 10 años, con el credito Manuel va a comprar una vaca para ampliar su egocio y de esta menera cubrir los gastos de educacion y mantencion de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel is a man who has two children. One of them is studying. Manuel has made a living from breeding livestock for 5 years. Manuel comments that although he does not live with his children, he does take on the children’s expenses. Manuel says that he is happy since his oldest son is already a professional, and that in that same way he needs to bring his 10-year-old son out ahead.

With the loan, Manuel is going to purchase a cow to increase his business and thus cover his children’s education and maintenance expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Chinda, pictured here, is 21 years old. She lives in a village across the Mekong River about 15 fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Chinda has one son who is in primary school. She works as a garment factory worker and her husband works in construction. Chinda’s husband needs additional construction materials to operate his business because his old materials cannot work.

Chinda is requesting a loan to buy construction materials for her husband.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her husband

loans.name: Diantoyerela Ii Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  DIANTOYERELA II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  25 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KADIANA VILLE, commune de KADIANA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec DJENEBOU 1ère personne accroupie à droite sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  2 hectares. La production est vendue au niveau de  KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte faire un bénéfice de 100.000FCFA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Diantoyerela II group are married women with an average age of 25 years and an average of 4 children each. They all live in polygamous families in Kadiana City, in the Kadiana community of the Kolondieba district, one of the districts in the third administrative region of Mali.

The women are partnering with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better run their farming business during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the organization, after having fully repaid their previous loan.

Djenebou, the first person pictured crouching on the right in the photo, is in the business of rice and ground nuts. With her loan, she plans to purchase supplies, seeds, and pay for labor to farm 2 hectares. 

Djenebou sells her crops in Kadiana after the harvest to a customer base made up of both men and womn. She plans to earn an income of 100,000 francs CFA, which will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, seeds, and labor for their agriculture business

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 60 years old and married with three children. For the past 10 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells items such as soft-drinks, bottled water, canned goods, cereals, coffee and other items. Priscilla works very hard to provide for her family.

Priscilla is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as soft-drinks, bottled water, canned goods, juice, cereals, coffee and other products. Priscilla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft-drinks, bottled water, canned goods, juice, cereals, coffee and other products

loans.name: Disery

texts.en:
Disery is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school. For the past 11 years, she has been buying and selling flower vases in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Disery is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of flower vases to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flower vases to sell

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 52 years old and married with three children. One of her children is still in school. For the past 13 years, Marita has run a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, canned goods, detergent, sugar, and other groceries. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Marita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as snack foods, noodles, canned goods, detergent, sugar and other groceries. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, noodles, canned goods, detergent, sugar and other groceries

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dina is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Dina has a buying and selling of used clothing business in the Philippines. Dina requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers.

Dina has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Dina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana works hard to support her family. Ana is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Ana requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Ana has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Ana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Aguelina

texts.en: Aguelina is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married, and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, milk, bread, body lotion, shampoo and slippers. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, water, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, eggs, milk, bread, body lotion, shampoo and slippers

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene es viudo y tiene tres hijos Rene vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Rene es chofer y solicita un credito para reparar su vehiculo, comprar bateria y otros repuestos. Rene no tiene a quien acudir y por eso y su buena evaluacion crediticia es que pide ayuda de Kiva
texts.en:
Rene is a widow and has three children. He lives in La Paz in his own home, which is made of brick and cement.

Rene is a chauffeur and requests this loan to repair his vehicle and purchase a battery and other spare parts. Rene does not have anyone else to turn to. Due to this and his good credit evaluation, he has requested assistance from Kiva.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle, and purchase a battery and other spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase thread, cloth, and to maintain her sewing machine.

loans.name: María Herminia

texts.es:
María tiene 30 años de edad, estudió hasta 4º grado, es madre soltera y el padre de sus hijos solo le ayuda para la manutención, sus hijos estudian y nadie mas depende de María.


María, desde hace años es empleada en una panadería, ella elabora pan dulce y pan francés el cual abastecen a muchas tiendas, ella buscó este empleo debido a la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos los cuales se involucran ayudándole a su madre en la elaboración de pan, el horario de trabajo es de 5.:00 AM a 3::00 P.M.


 
El préstamo lo necesita para solventar varias deudas, y lo demás para gastos personales, de esa forma María cubrirá las necesidades económicas que tiene en este momento.

El sueño de María es que sus hijos estudien, que en un futuro sean profesionales y se ganen la vida por si mismos, lo logrará mediante su trabajo y esfuerzo.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old. She attended school until 4th grade. She is a single mother, and the father of her children only helps by paying support. Her children are in school and she does not support anyone else. 

For the past few years, María has worked in a bakery. She makes sweet breads and French breads and supplies them to many stores. She got this job because she needed to support her children, who help her to make bread. She works from 5:00 am until 3:00 pm.

She needs the loan to pay various debts and pay for personal expenses. This way, María will be able to pay the necessary expenses that she has at this time.

María's dream is that her children study, become professionals in the future, and support themselves through hard work and effort.

loans.use: to pay various debts and pay for personal expenses.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 46 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Angeles has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Angeles requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like spices, vegetables, noodles, meat, fish, etc., for her business.

Angeles has been in this business for 15 years. Angeles would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like spices, vegetables, noodles, meat, fish, etc., for her business

loans.name: Aniana

texts.en:
Aniana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Aniana has been in this business for seven years. Aniana earns more income from buying and selling toilet bowl cleaner.

Aniana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Chanthoeurn

texts.en:
Chanthoeurn, 23 years old, lives in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a hardworking farmer in the rice farmland near her house. She has only one baby son, and her husband is also a farmer. Farming, which is the main source of her income, can allow her to make about USD $3 in one day.

Chanthoeurn wants to promote her living conditions by using a hygienic latrine, which she never once had before. She is borrowing money from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Through this loan, she hopes that it will help her to promote her health and living conditions. She would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Janidy

texts.en:
Janidy works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her general store business and is now requesting a PHP 9,800 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Janidy will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Janidy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fishing business and is now requesting a PHP 9,871 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Jona will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Jona would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annaliza is 42 years old; two of her children are currently in school.

Annaliza has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines. Annaliza requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Annaliza has been in this business for six years. In the future, Annaliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia works hard to support her family. Aurelia is widowed and has a gravestone making business in the Philippines.

Aurelia requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like marmol (marble), paint, etc., for her business.

Aurelia has been in this business for 16 years now.

Aurelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like marmol (marble), paint, etc., for her business

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Dona is 28 years old and is married with three children, one of whom is in school. Dona works very hard to provide for them.

Dona's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Dona has restarted her charcoal retailing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Dona has taken a PHP 9,714 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Dona is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ohm Sakthi Shg Group

texts.en:
People's Action for Transformation (PAT) is a group of socially conscious people from different social and economic background. “Ohm Sakthi” SHG is maintained by PAT. This group consists of 14 active women from Nagamangalam village of Tamil Nadu. 

These women use mud stoves for their day-to-day cooking. They spend about three to four hours per day for cooking. Since these stoves emit a lot of smoke, which is hazardous to their health, they are now planning to buy smokeless stoves, for which they are requesting a loan.

Vinothsobanakumari is the featured borrower of this group. She is married and has two children. She will buy a smokeless stove.

Each stove costs INR 1,400. They hope to save time and have better health.

loans.use: to buy a smokeless stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to fertilize his cornfield. He will purchase 4 bags of fertilizer, 2 bags of seeds, pay rent, and pay laborers.

loans.name: Suor

texts.en:
Suor lives in a village across the Mekong River about 15 km from Phnom Penh City. He has six children. Five of his children are married and live separately and another is a porter.
 
Suor and his wife are farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in the village where they live. Suor applied for a loan to buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

In the photo, Suor is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.name: Lyna's Group

texts.en:
Lyna was selected to be a group leader for a loan from MAXIMA. In the group, there are two members, Lyna and Kum. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh.
  
Lyna, age 22, works for a place that produces Khmer noodles. She has been married since 2011 and has no children yet.  

Lyna uses electricity from her neighbor, who charges her a high price. She is now applying for a loan to connect her house to the electricity utility service, whose price is lower. 

Lyna is on the left and Kum is on the right.

loans.use: to connect her house to the electricity utility service.

loans.name: Carla

texts.en:
Carla applying for a loan of $1,500.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has one child. This is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as sugar, noodles, eggs, cigarettes, shampoo and slippers.

Carla opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $200.00. She is earning a good income, and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sugar, noodles, eggs, cigarettes, shampoo and slippers

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry works hard to support her family. Cherry is widowed and has a plastic bag making business in the Philippines. Cherry has been in this business for six years now.

Cherry requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Cherry would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.en:
Ermelinda, 40, is a married woman with six children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ermelinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ermelinda has been in this business for 23 years.

Ermelinda requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, fish, vegetables, seasonings, etc. for her food production business.

In the future, Ermelinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, spices, fish, vegetables, seasonings, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a cellphone repair business business in the Philippines.

Lilibeth requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional tools and spare parts for her business.  She has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and spare parts for her business

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 58 years old, married and has four children. 

Juanita and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Juanita is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,800 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Juanita has been a NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her fishing business.

With your help, Juanita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rosa  Emilia

texts.es:
Al salir el sol es el principal indicador que un día laborioso comienza para Rosa, una mujer amable y trabajadora que prepara enchiladas, fritura popular nicaragüense, las cuales vende de manera ambulante en las principales calles de su comunidad. Tiene 36 años de edad, está en unión libre y tiene tres  hijos. Hace ocho años inició en el negocio de ventas con el objetivo de apoyar en la economía familiar, su compañero de vida ha sido su principal apoyo en su lucha diaria.
Rosa solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar masa, arroz y carne. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que anhela crecer en el negocio, lograr aumentar su clientela  y al mismo tiempo sus ingresos. Uno de sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar para ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y logren salir adelante, de manera que puedan triunfar en la vida
texts.en:
The sun coming out is the main indicator that a laborious day is beginning for Rosa. She is a kind and hard-working woman that prepares enchiladas, a popular Nicaraguan fried food that is sold on foot in the main streets of her community. She is 36 years old. She is in a civil union and has three children. Eight years ago he began in the business of sales with the goal of supporting the family economy. Her life partner has been her main support in her daily struggle.

Rosa is requesting the loan to increase the production of her capital. She needs to purchase dough, rice, and meat. She is placing her confidence in the loan given that she yearns to grow her business, and to be able to increase her customers, and at the same time her income. One of her future plans is to improve the infrastructure of her home to offer better living conditions to her family. Her dream is that her children study and be able to come out ahead in a way that they can triumph in life.

loans.use: to purchase dough, rice, and meat.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fishing business and is now requesting a 9,871.40 Philippines pesos (PHP) housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help, Analyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia lives in Dhok Dassu region of Rawalpindi with her family. 

Her husband makes a living  for their family by driving a taxi. He has been driving a taxi for eight years. 

Due to constant wear and tear, the taxi needs to be repaired. Asia therefore wants to help her husband and so is generating funding by requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner. 

As the major source of income comes from the taxi, it's important that they repair it timely.

Asia and her husband are hopeful for a prosperous future for their family.

loans.use: To repair the taxi.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en: Fely, 45 years of age, is married and blessed with two children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village, which she has done for almost four years. She is earning a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income is usually spent on the school allowances of her children. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase beverages, frozen foods, chips, coffee, sugar, and milk. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, frozen foods, chips, coffee, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Ching

texts.en:
Ching is 48 years old, married, and has six children. With two children in school, Ching works very hard to provide for them.

Ching's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Ching has restarted her fishing and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ching has taken a PHP 9,985.70 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ching is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as noodles, rice, oils and bread. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with the loan because it is offered to poor people to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, oils and bread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle for selling the meat.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 57 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Delma's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Delma is taking out a PHP 9,171.40 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Delma has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Delma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 51 years old, married, and has nine children. 

Felisa is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Felisa has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and she has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Felisa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer, 30, is a married woman with five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jennifer has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. Jennifer has been in this business for 4 years.

Jennifer requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like knives, slippers, etc., to sell to her customers.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items like knives, slippers, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fátima Nohemy

texts.es:
Fátima es una joven emprendedora de 21 años de edad, estudió hasta 5º grado debido a los problemas económicos de su familia, ahora ella está acompañada, su pareja trabaja de albañil y tienen una pequeña hija.


Fátima se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y pan francés que elabora una una panadería, esta actividad la realiza todos los días y también vende refrescos en una parada de buses, ella decidió dedicarse a este trabajo debido a la necesidad de sacar adelante a su hija y darle lo necesario para el sustento, en el trabajo de Fátima se involucra su madre y lo realizan en un horario de 6:00 AM a 4:00 PM.

El préstamo lo necesita para incrementar su negocio, comprará frutas para vender en los buses, de esa forma tendrá más ingresos económicos y podrá darle lo necesario a su hija. 

El sueño de Fátima es seguir con sus ventas y que sus ingresos mejoren cada día.
texts.en: Fátima is an enterprising 21 year old who only studied up to Grade 5 due to her family's economic problems. She is now in a common-law relationship. Her partner works as a bricklayer and they have a young daughter. Fátima sells sweetbreads and French bread that is made by a bakery. She does this daily and she also sells soft drinks at a bus stop. She decided to do this work as she needed to raise her child and provide sustenance for her. Fátima's mother is also involved in this work. She works from 6 am until 4 pm. The loan is needed to expand the business, buying fruit to sell on the buses. Doing this she will have more economic income and can provide what is needed for her child. Fátima's dream is to continue with her sales and have her income improve every day.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell on buses.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy a refrigerator and stocks to keep in her store such as rice, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, water and oils. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, rice, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko, beer, water and oils.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

Lolita has been in this business for 14 years now.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar es soltero pero tiene dos hijos Oscar vive en La Paz en una casa que es propia Oscar es comerciante y necesita un credito para abrir una tienda de abarrotes Oscar es el unico sustento de su hijo por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Oscar is single and has two children. He lives in La Paz in his own home. He is a merchant and needs a loan to open his own general store. He is the only source of support for his children, which is why he needs assistance.

loans.use: to open a general store.

loans.name: Davlatjon

texts.en:
Davlatjon is 37 years old, and married with three children. Being a responsible mother, Davlatjon works hard every day to generate income so that she can cover her daily costs and send some of her children to school.  

She is dedicated to her farming business, growing cotton, tomatoes, watermelon and wheat on her own land. In order to contribute to improving her family's living standards, she has been working from early morning till late evening for three years.

Davlatjon would like to develop business, which is why she is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to purchase mineral fertilizer and seeds for the new planting season. 

She hopes that KIVA lenders won’t reject her loan, and she thanks lenders in advance for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer and seeds for the new planting season

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a business selling beauty products in the Philippines. Aileen has been in this business for eight years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Aileen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more beauty products to sell to her customers.

Aileen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anabelle
